title: A quiz has 20 questions. 7 marks are allotted for each correct answer. 2 marks are deducted for each wrong answer. 0 marks are given for each omitted answer. A boy got 87 marks in the quiz. How many questions did he omit? - Quora

response.answer_text: The answer is 5. There are three variables in the question. x = Number of questions the boy got correct y = Number of questions the boy got wrong z = Number of questions the boy omitted. There are two equations according to the given conditions: x + y + z = 20 7x - 2y = 87 Let us look at the second equation first. We can easily guess that since x and y are whole numbers, the value of x has to be odd to meet the equation. Also, x should be greater than 12. So, let’s start putting odd whole number values, greater than 12 for x and try to corresponding values for y. We will have the following combinations: x = 13 ; y = 2 x = 15 ; y = 9 x = 17 ; y = 16 Since, the sum of x and y cannot exceed 20, only the first case is possible according to the question. Putting these values of x and y in the first equation, we have z = 5

Assuming the boy has [math]a[/math] correct answers and [math]b[/math] wrong ones, we have [math]7a-2b=87[/math] and [math]a+b \le 20[/math]. We may assume that both [math]a[/math] and [math]b[/math] are non-negative integers. Now [math]7a=2b+87[/math] implies [math]a \ge \left \lceil \frac{87}{7} \right \rceil= 13[/math], and [math]a[/math] is odd. If [math]a \ge 15[/math], then [math]2b=7a-87 \ge 18[/math]. But then [math]b \ge 9[/math], and so [math]a+b>20[/math], which is impossible. Thus [math]a=13[/math], [math]b=\frac{7a-87}{2}=2[/math], and so the number of unattempted questions is [math]5[/math]. [math]\blacksquare[/math]
